content.body: https://github.com/gpuweb/gpuweb/pull/2416 has some additional WebGPU and <canvas> integration discussion, if anyone's interested. (Been trying to steer them in a direction that more closely matches the existing contexts. It seems this went unnoticed in the TAG review.)

content.body:
> Enter the Storage Access API. This API lets third parties request storage access as if they were a first party. This is called “unpartitioning” and it gives browsers and users control over which third parties can maintain state across first-party origins as well as determine which origins they can access that state from.

(from https://hacks.mozilla.org/2022/02/improving-the-storage-access-api-in-firefox/) annevk - here "storage" is just cookies, right?
content.formatted_body:
Enter the Storage Access API. This API lets third parties request storage access as if they were a first party. This is called “unpartitioning” and it gives browsers and users control over which third parties can maintain state across first-party origins as well as determine which origins they can access that state from.

(from https://hacks.mozilla.org/2022/02/improving-the-storage-access-api-in-firefox/) annevk - here "storage" is just cookies, right?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:

This is called “unpartitioning” and it gives browsers and users control over which third parties can maintain state across first-party origins as well as determine which origins they can access that state from.

(from https://hacks.mozilla.org/2022/02/improving-the-storage-access-api-in-firefox/) annevk - here "storage" is just cookies, right?

Enter the Storage Access API. This API lets third parties request storage access as if they were a first party. This is called “unpartitioning” and it gives browsers and users control over which third parties can maintain state across first-party origins as well as determine which origins they can access that state from.

(from https://hacks.mozilla.org/2022/02/improving-the-storage-access-api-in-firefox/) annevk - here "storage" is just cookies, right?

content.body: i thought that was the plan, but it references unpartitioning storage a few times and i'm confused now
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: i thought that was the plan, but it references unpartitioning storage a few times and i'm confused now

content.body: ok, i just saw https://github.com/privacycg/storage-partitioning/issues/9#issuecomment-1035960211, so probably yes "storage" means _only_ cookies in the blog post
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: ok, i just saw https://github.com/privacycg/storage-partitioning/issues/9#issuecomment-1035960211, so probably yes "storage" means _only_ cookies in the blog post
